column4: Does ubuntu support netgear usb wireless out of the box or do I have to find a seperate driver set (seperate drivers shouldnt be a problem for me)
you'll have to find out what driver it uses; it should be supported.
do you know which driver it uses?
but it is included on ubuntu's installation cd.
http://www.linux-wlan.org/docs/wlan_adapters.html.gz  look for your card and post back here which chipset it uses...
that's ok, just let me know which chipset it uses and i'll help you out.
ok, i don't think madwifi will support it.  (btw, you should probably refer to me by name; your post gets highlighted in my client and it's just good chat etiquette. :)
do you know which one you have?
do you know which version of your netgear card you have?
netgear ma111 wireless adapter, 802.11b, (Prism2/2.5/3 chipset via wlan)
yes, but you say there are two versions; which one do you have?
ok, but there are still two versions and that will matter. :)
now, google for netgear ma111 v1 linux and see what comes up; you're looking for driver or chipset.
refer to me by name, please. :)
